text: The Council of Constance was a council in the 15th century. It was held between 1414 and 1418. It took place in Constance (today known as Konstanz) in Switzerland. "Council of Constance," Catholic Encyclopedia (2009); retrieved 2011-12-9. The result of this ecumenical council by the Roman Catholic Church was a new Pope. His name was Pope Martin V. "Pope Martin V," Catholic Encyclopedia; retrieved 2011-12-9. ==References == == Other websites == Category:Christianity in Germany Constance Category:15th century in Germany Category:Konstanz Category:Roman Catholicism Category:1410s Category:History of Switzerland
title: Council of Constance
